results.title: A Randomized Controlled Trial of Lisinopril to Decrease Lymphoid Fibrosis in Antiretroviral-Treated, HIV-infected Individuals
results.text_hl: A Randomized Controlled Trial of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ to Decrease @DISEASE_Fibrosis @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@Lymphoid Fibrosis@@@ in Antiretroviral-Treated, @<m>DISEASE_HIV_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015658 @@@HIV-infected@@@ Individuals

results.title: Complete remission of non-HIV collapsing glomerulopathy with deflazacort and lisinopril in an adult patient.
results.text_hl: Complete remission of non@<m>DISEASE_HIV_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015658 @@@-HIV@@@ @DISEASE_Pulmonary_Atelectasis @DISEASE_MESH:D001261 @@@collapsing glomerulopathy@@@ with @CHEMICAL_deflazacort @CHEMICAL_MESH:C021988 @@@deflazacort@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ in an adult @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@.

citations.NLM: Vega J, Guarda FJ, Goecke H, Méndez GP. Complete remission of non-HIV collapsing glomerulopathy with deflazacort and lisinopril in an adult patient. Clin Exp Nephrol. 2010 Aug;14(4):385-8. PMID: 20428916

results.title: Angiotensin Converting Enzyme Inhibitor and HMG-CoA Reductase Inhibitor as Adjunct Treatment for Persons with HIV Infection: A Feasibility Randomized Trial
results.text_hl: We found that among persons with @<m>DISEASE_HIV_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015658 @@@HIV infection@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ use was associated with a decline in biomarkers of @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@systemic inflammation@@@.

citations.NLM: Baker JV, Huppler Hullsiek K, Prosser R, Duprez D, Grimm R, Tracy RP, Rhame F, Henry K, Neaton JD. Angiotensin Converting Enzyme Inhibitor and HMG-CoA Reductase Inhibitor as Adjunct Treatment for Persons with HIV Infection: A Feasibility Randomized Trial  PLoS One. 2012;7(10):e46894. PMID: 23082133

results.title: Cardiovascular complications of HIV: an overview of risk and a novel approach to prevention - the HIV polypill study.
results.text_hl: An @SPECIES_11676 @@@HIV@@@ polypill study with 8000 @<m>DISEASE_HIV_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015658 @@@HIV-infected@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with a moderate risk of @DISEASE_Cardiovascular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D002318 @@@cardiovascular disease@@@ randomized to either a polypill of low-dose @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@aspirin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ or to placebo is described.

citations.NLM: Law MG. Cardiovascular complications of HIV: an overview of risk and a novel approach to prevention - the HIV polypill study. Curr Opin HIV AIDS. 2006 Nov;1(6):482-7. PMID: 19372850
citations.BibTeX: @article{19372850, title={Cardiovascular complications of HIV: an overview of risk and a novel approach to prevention - the HIV polypill study.}, author={Law MG}, journal={Curr Opin HIV AIDS}, volume={1}, number={6}, pages={482-7}}
